dataBase

Class Mazeclass

  • java.lang.Object
    • dataBase.Mazeclass
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Maze

    public class Mazeclass
extends java.lang.Object
implements Maze
    Author:
    Rafael Gameiro & Rui Santos

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Mazeclass()
      Initialises the rowCount at zero; Initialises the colCount at zero; creates a new mapObject class with the size of the rowCount and colCount; it sets the futureCharSign as " ";

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addRebel(int row, int col)
      in the inserted coordinates it will change the character to "R";
      void defineMap(char[][] array, int rowCount, int colCount)
      goes through the param array and each character will create a new object, in the same position of array, but in the array of objects, map; the object can be a blank space or a wall;
      int getColCount() 
      int getRowCount() 
      char getSymbol(int row, int col) 
      boolean hasBlankSpace(int row, int col)
      checks if in that position the character is a blank space (" ");
      boolean hasMap()
      checks if the value of rowCount and colCount its still the standard one; if yes it means there hasn't been created a map;
      int howManyGuns(char[][] array)
      goes through the param array and if it finds a character "." it increment the value of a local variable by one;
      boolean isAwakenRebel(int row, int col)
      checks if in that position the character is a rebel that drunk a potion ("S");
      boolean isGun(int row, int col)
      checks if in that position the character is a gun (".");
      boolean isPotion(int row, int col)
      checks if in that position the character is a potion ("P");
      boolean isRebel(int row, int col)
      checks if in that position the character is a rebel ("R");
      boolean isStormtrooper(int row, int col)
      checks if in that position the character is a stormtrooper ("O", "B" or "W");
      boolean isWall(int row, int col)
      checks if in that position the character is a wall ("#");
      IteratorMap Iterator()
      allows to print the map;
      void moveRebel(int oldRow, int oldCol, char sign, int row, int col)
      it will set in the coordinates (row,col) the character that define the rebel; in the coordinates (oldRow,oldCol) that character will be a blank space (" ");
      void moveStormtrooper(int oldRow, int oldCol, char future, char color, int row, int col)
      it will set in the coordinates (row,col) the character that define the stormtrooper; firstly it checks if the variable future doesn't contain a blank space (" ") or a character that define a rebel ("R"); if not in the coordinates (oldRow,oldCol) that character will be the character contained in the variable future; if it has, in the coordinates (oldRow,oldCol) that character will be a blank space (" ");
      char setOldChar() 
      void setSymbol(char symbol, int row, int col)
      will set in the coordinates (row,col) the character that is in the variable symbol;

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • moveStormtrooper

        public void moveStormtrooper(int oldRow,
                             int oldCol,
                             char future,
                             char color,
                             int row,
                             int col)
        Description copied from interface: Maze
        it will set in the coordinates (row,col) the character that define the stormtrooper; firstly it checks if the variable future doesn't contain a blank space (" ") or a character that define a rebel ("R"); if not in the coordinates (oldRow,oldCol) that character will be the character contained in the variable future; if it has, in the coordinates (oldRow,oldCol) that character will be a blank space (" ");
        Specified by:
        moveStormtrooper in interface Maze
        Parameters:
        oldRow - current row position of stormtrooper;
        oldCol - current column position of stormtrooper;
        future - char that was in the position where the stormtrooper is;
        color - character that define stormtrooper;
        row - future row position of stormtrooper;
        col - future column position of stormtrooper;
